summary:
Over the 6‑hour window winds averaged ~15.2 m/s with low variability but included a high gust to 34.7 m/s; power output was very steady (~0.976) with negligible short‑term variance, rotor speed was effectively constant, pitch averaged ~10.5°, and yaw misalignment averaged ~1.6°.  

At the same time, the mean power residual was about −0.085 indicating a persistent shortfall versus expected output, the system was in a non‑normal state for the entire window, and temperatures were elevated (~65°C).
